pullRequest.body:
As is, this linter only works on a "static" file: any edit will cause the linter to flag perfectly reasonable code!

The `DocModule` style linter is a syntax linter that checks if a file starts with
```lean
import*
/-! doc-module -/
```

It emits a warning if a file does not have a doc-module string as its first non-`import` command.

In particular, the linter allows `import`-only files to have no doc-module string.

The linter also allows files in the `test` folder to not have doc-module strings.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6790b00dc6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15794/commits/6790b00dc60e0ffb77aefaab2b2c3f8a81d7ccf4)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter | 20 | 22 | +2 (+10.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic | 2173 | 2175 | +2 (+0.09%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4138 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 174576 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ docModuleLinter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

I will get to this linter later - reminder to myself (and perhaps you also) to add a comment about thread safety, per [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/Using.20.60IO.2ERef.60).
The linter at #16574 should be a better implementation of this one.

I look a more detailed look. The overall idea looks nicely done, as usual.
- As you say, it would be good to avoid the flimsy IO.Ref usage, so reloading the file is not necessary.
- ~~I wonder if this linter works as intended if you have a module doc-string *before* imports.~~ impossible, see below
- Can you add a test for this? I am not confident I'd get the detailed logic right on first try, the `undoc?` and `terminal?` both flip twice throughout the file, which is subtle enough to not be "entirely obvious".
Update: I agree that is slightly tricky, as the linter disables itself in the `tests` directory... would the same trick as in the other PR help - disabling this linter by default, enabling it in mathlib, but disabling *this particular* linter in the tests directory?
Thanks, Michael!  I've thought about this, and I think that this use of an `IO.Ref` is not going to work with the linter.  I'll implement a different version!

Is "module docstring" more standard? That seems to be what the documentation guide uses...
```suggestion
/-! Module docstring -/

```suggestion
It emits a warning if a file does not have a module doc-string right after its `import` statements.
Please apply the same changes as above. Thanks :-)
I slightly prefer `if (← getMainModule).getRoot == `test then return`; what do you think?

```suggestion
  -- `test` files are not required to have a module doc-string.

```suggestion

If `undocumented` is `false` at the start of the docModule linter parsing,
the linter emits a warning, unless the parsed syntax is a module doc-string.

Reading the source code, this also returns True on an #exit command... ah, you mean to include that in "the end of the file", I see! Do you think "the end of the processed file" is clearer?

How about naming this `isTerminal`? This returns a Bool, not an Option, after all.
This disappeared now, to the comment is resolved!  :smile:
`terminal?` is used only once - inline it?
Good catch!

I am worried about one edge case: what happens if you have a module docstring *before* imports?
It seems this is allowed by the linter - is that what we want?

I just tested this locally: Lean forces the first command in a file to be imports - this means module docstrings cannot go *before* imports. It would be nice to document this - this is implicitly used by the linter.
I don't think that this needs to be specified, as it is already enforced by the syntax.
Can you avoid the double negation? I had to think twice about whether this was the right way around...
Used a plain `if ... then` instead of double negation.

What do you think about reversing the order, like so?
```
`Mathlib` files must contain a module doc-string between their list of `import`s and the first non-`import` command.
Please add a module doc-string before this command.
I reversed the order, but prefer to talk about the first non-`import` command: this covers the case of import-only files, albeit implicitly.

pullRequest.title: feat: the DocModule linter

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the header linter

nodes.body: The linter at #16574 should be a better implementation of this one.
